monogr.title: Drum Beats: Walt Whitman's Civil War Boy Lovers

bibl.author: William E. Vandemark
bibl.title: William E. Vandemark to Walt Whitman, 2 November 1863
bibl.orgName: The Walt Whitman Collection, Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center, The University of Texas at Austin

body.p: I now take the plesurepleasure of fulfilling my promacepromise a writing to you hoping those few lines will find you well 1 am getting better fast

iI am at home now iI got home after noon my famlyfamily is well iI left washingtonWashington wensdayWednesday we got to JurseyJersey city thursdayThursday twelve oclock then we was taken to davidsDavid's islindIsland and then fridayFriday they gave us passes for 8 days iI will come to brooklinBrooklyn sundaySunday morning iI wish that yoyou would meet me at fultenFulten street feryferry iI long to see yoyou and have a long talk with yo
It rains here this morning and to day is lectionelection one of my neighbor men runs for member of assembly he is a good union man and iI hope that he will get elected for he is a good union man—

iI am in the hospittlehospital on davidsDavid's island up the east river the hospittlehospital is very large and nice place we have nice breazesbreezes of wind all the wilewhile iI suppose that there will hefhave to be some heavy fitingfighting soon agenagain the rain :has made very hiwaterhigh water here
iI am soon going to lectionelection to go the union ticket hope the state will go union all through

the poor for us their prayers will send for blessing rich and endless and was not Jesus poor a friend to us—else poor and friendly that through his poverty and pain we might the bliss of angels gain a christian help the needy
well father iI will close now with giveing yoyou the address
write soon for iI long to heerhear from yoyou from William E Vandemark to his father good by
